Agreements</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Exhibit
K<font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;-<font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160; Form of
Tenant Estoppel Certificate</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Exhibit
L<font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;-<font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;&#160; Notice
to Tenants</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Exhibit
M<font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;
</font>-&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
Notice to Vendors</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Exhibit
N<font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;-<font id="TAB2" style="LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;&#160;&#160;</font>&#160;&#160;Relationship
Side Letter </font></div>

        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">

              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">-&#160;ii&#160;-</font></div>
              <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt" align="left">&#160;</div>

            <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;

          <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;

          <div id="HDR">
            <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 8pt; COLOR: #000000; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">&#160;
</font></div>
          </div>
        </div><br>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt"><br></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">AMENDED AND RESTATED
</font>AGREEMENT OF PURCHASE AND SALE</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">THIS
AMENDED AND RESTATED AGREEMENT OF PURCHASE AND SALE (this &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Agreement</font>&#8221;), dated as of
January 31, 2008, is entered into by and between <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">HARVEST-GRANITE SAN TOMAS LLC, a
</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Delaware limited
liability company </font>(&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Seller</font>&#8221;), and <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">HARVEST
2400, LLC</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">, a Delaware
limited liability company </font>(&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Buyer</font>&#8221;).</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">RECITALS</font></font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">A.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Seller
is the owner of certain real property (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Real Property</font>&#8221;), consisting of
approximately 24.67 acres, commonly known as 2600 - 2880 San Tomas Expressway,
located in the City and County of Santa Clara (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">County</font>&#8221;), California (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">State</font>&#8221;), more particularly
described in <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Exhibit&#160;A</font>
attached hereto.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">B.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;The
Real Property has constructed thereon certain buildings and related improvements
(collectively, &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Improvements</font>&#8221;).</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">C.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;The
Real Property, Improvements, Personal Property (as defined on <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Exhibit&#160;G</font>
attached hereto), and Other Property (as defined on <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Exhibit&#160;B</font>
attached hereto) are hereinafter collectively referred to as the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Property</font>.&#8221;</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">D.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Seller
and San Tomas Investors, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Original Buyer</font>&#8221;) entered into
an Agreement of Purchase and Sale, dated December 28, 2007, with respect to the
Property (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Original
Agreement</font>&#8221;).</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">E.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Conditioned
upon the concurrent execution and delivery of this Agreement, Original Buyer is
concurrently assigning the Original Agreement to Buyer pursuant to an Assignment
and Assumption of Agreement of Purchase and Sale , dated January 31,
2008.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">NOW,
THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing and the mutual covenants contained
herein, the parties agree as follows:</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">I.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;The
parties agree that the Original Agreement is amended and restated, as of January
31, 2008, in its entirety by this Agreement.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: center" align="center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">AGREEMENT</font></font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">1.</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">PURCHASE
AND SALE</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Seller
agrees to sell and convey to Buyer, and Buyer agrees to purchase from Seller,
the Property on the terms and subject to the conditions set forth in this
Agreement. For the purposes of this Agreement, the term &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Effective Date</font>&#8221;, as used
herein shall mean December 28, 2007.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2.</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">PURCHASE
PRICE</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
purchase price for the Property is equal to the amount of One Hundred Forty-Nine
Million, Three Hundred Fifty-Four Thousand, Fifty Dollars and No Cents
($149,354,050.00) (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Purchase
Price</font>&#8221;).</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
          <div id="FTR">
            <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">1</font></div>
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="HDR">
            <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
            </div>
          </div>
        </div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">3.</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">PAYMENT
OF PURCHASE PRICE</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Purchase Price for the Property shall be payable by Buyer as
follows:</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(a)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Deposit</font>.&#160;&#160;On
or before two&#160;(2) business days following the following the Effective Date,
Buyer has paid to Seller the amount of Fifty Thousand Dollars&#160;($50,000)
(together with any interest accrued thereon, the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">First</font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Deposit</font>&#8221;) which shall be
nonrefundable notwithstanding any termination of this Agreement.&#160;&#160;On
or before one&#160;(1) business day following the expiration of the Contingency
Period (as defined below), Buyer shall cause an additional Four Million, Four
Hundred Fifty Thousand Dollars&#160;($4,450,000) in immediately available funds
(together with any interest accrued thereon, the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Second Deposit</font>&#8221;) in
immediately available funds to be delivered into Escrow with First American
Title Insurance Company, 1737&#160;North First Street, Suite&#160;100, San Jose
California 95112, Attn:&#160;Dian Blair (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Escrow
Holder</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The First Deposit and the Second Deposit shall be
collectively referred to herein as the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Deposit</font>&#8221;.&#160;&#160;The
Second Deposit shall be invested by Escrow Holder with a financial institution
acceptable to Buyer and Seller in a federally-insured interest-bearing demand
account (with any risk of loss for the account of Buyer), and the Second
Deposit, and all interest accrued on the Second Deposit, shall be credited to
the Purchase Price upon the Close of Escrow.&#160;&#160;Following the expiration
of the Contingency Period (as hereinafter defined), unless this Agreement has
been previously terminated or deemed terminated by Buyer pursuant to its rights
set forth in this Agreement, the Second Deposit shall, except as otherwise
provided in this Agreement to the contrary, become
non-refundable.&#160;&#160;The Deposit shall be credited against the Purchase
Price at Close of Escrow.&#160;&#160;The failure of Buyer to timely deliver any
of the Deposits shall be a material default, and shall entitle Seller, at
Seller&#8217;s sole option, to terminate this Agreement immediately by giving written
notice of such termination to Buyer and the Escrow Holder.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(b)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Cash at Close of
Escrow</font>.&#160;&#160;On or before the Close of Escrow, Buyer shall deposit
with Escrow Holder the remaining portion of the Purchase Price, in immediately
available funds, which shall be paid to Seller at Close of Escrow.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">4.</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">ESCROW</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(a)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Opening of
Escrow</font>.&#160;&#160;Seller has opened an escrow (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Escrow</font>&#8221;), Escrow
No.&#160;NCS-332894-SC, with Escrow Holder on or prior to the Effective
Date.&#160;&#160;Buyer and Seller agree to execute and deliver to Escrow Holder,
in a timely manner, all escrow instructions necessary to consummate the
transaction contemplated by this Agreement.&#160;&#160;Any such instructions
shall not conflict with, amend or supersede any portion of this
Agreement.&#160;&#160;If there is any inconsistency between such instructions
and this Agreement, this Agreement shall control.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(b)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Close of
Escrow</font>.&#160;&#160;For purposes of this Agreement, &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Close of Escrow</font>&#8221; shall be
defined as the date that the Grant Deed (as hereinafter defined) is recorded in
the Official Records of the County.&#160;&#160;The Close of Escrow shall occur
on or before February 15, 2008 (subject to extension solely pursuant to the
terms and conditions of this Agreement or by the mutual agreement of the parties
in their sole and absolute discretion, the&#160;&#160;&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Closing Date</font>&#8221;).</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">5.</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">CONDITIONS
OF TITLE</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">The
Property shall be conveyed to Buyer by Seller by a Grant Deed, in the form
attached hereto as <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Exhibit&#160;F</font>
(&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Grant Deed</font>&#8221;), subject
only to (a)&#160;a lien to secure payment of real estate taxes, bonds and
assessments not delinquent; (b)&#160;the lien of supplemental taxes, not
delinquent; and (c)&#160;exceptions which are approved and/or accepted by Buyer
in writing in accordance with this Agreement; (d)&#160;laws, ordinances or
governmental regulations, including but not limited to, building and zoning
laws, ordinances and regulations, now existing or hereafter in effect with
respect to the Property; (e)&#160;matters affecting the condition of title
created by or with the written consent of </font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">
          <div id="FTR">
            <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">

          </div>
          <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">2</font></div>
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
            </div>
          </div>

            <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">

          </div>
          <div>&#160;</div>
          <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Buyer;
(f)&#160;water rights, and claims of title to water, if shown by the public
records; (g)&#160;conflicts in boundary lines, encroachments, and any state of
facts which an inspection of the Property would disclose and which are not shown
by the public records; and (h)&#160;standard printed exclusions generally
included in a CLTA owner&#8217;s policy (or ALTA owner&#8217;s policy, as the case may be)
(collectively, &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Approved
Conditions of Title</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Notwithstanding anything to the
contrary contained in this Agreement, Buyer hereby disapproves all liens
evidencing deeds of trust or mortgages or other liens securing monetary
obligations, judgment liens, liens for delinquent real estate property taxes and
assessments and mechanic&#8217;s liens, other than mechanics liens solely due to
Buyer, and Seller agrees to cause all such liens to be eliminated at Seller&#8217;s
sole cost and expense (including all prepayment penalties and charges) prior to
or concurrently with the Close of Escrow.&#160;&#160;Issuance by the Title
Company (or an unconditional commitment to issue) as of the Close of Escrow of
the Title Policy shall constitute the required delivery of title by
Seller.</font></div>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">6.</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">CONDITIONS
TO CLOSE OF ESCROW</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(a)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Conditions to Buyer&#8217;s
Obligations</font>.&#160;&#160;The Close of Escrow and Buyer&#8217;s obligation to
consummate the transactions contemplated by this Agreement is subject to the
satisfaction of the following conditions (or Buyer&#8217;s waiver thereof) which are
for Buyer&#8217;s sole benefit, on or prior to the dates designated below for the
satisfaction of such conditions, or the Close of Escrow in absence of a
specified date:</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 72pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(i)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Title and
Survey</font>.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 117pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(a)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Title</font>.&#160;&#160;Buyer
shall have the right to approve any and all matters of and exceptions to title
of the Property, including the legal description, as disclosed by the following
documents and instruments (collectively, &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Title
Documents</font>&#8221;):&#160;&#160;(A)&#160;a preliminary title report (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Preliminary Report</font>&#8221;) issued by
the Title Company (as hereinafter defined) with respect to the Property and all
matters referenced therein; and (B)&#160;legible copies of all documents,
whether recorded or unrecorded, referred to in such Preliminary
Report.&#160;&#160;Seller shall cause Escrow Holder to deliver the Title
Documents to Buyer within five&#160;(5) calendar days following the Effective
Date.&#160;&#160;Buyer shall have ten&#160;(10) business days following the
Effective Date to give Seller and Escrow Holder written notice (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Buyer&#8217;s Title Notice</font>&#8221;) of
Buyer&#8217;s approval or disapproval, which shall be made in Buyer&#8217;s sole and
absolute discretion, of the legal description and every item or exception
disclosed by the Title Documents.&#160;&#160;The failure of Buyer to give
Buyer&#8217;s Title Notice to Seller within the specified time period shall be deemed
Buyer&#8217;s disapproval of title to the Property.&#160;&#160;In the event that
Buyer&#8217;s Title Notice disapproves of any matter of title shown in the Title
Documents, Seller shall, within three&#160;(3) business days after Buyer&#8217;s Title
Notice is received by Seller, give Buyer written notice (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Seller&#8217;s Title Notice</font>&#8221;)
(a)&#160;that Seller will remove such objectionable exceptions from title on or
before the Close of Escrow, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">provided</font> <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">that</font> Seller may extend the
Close of Escrow for such period as shall be required to effect such cure, but
not beyond ten&#160;(10) days or (b)&#160;that Seller elects not to cause such
exceptions to be removed.&#160;&#160;If Seller fails to timely give such notice
to Buyer, Seller shall be deemed to have given notice to Buyer under
clause&#160;(b).&#160;&#160;Seller shall have no obligation to remove any title
exceptions to which Buyer objects other than those that Seller has agreed to
remove in Section&#160;5 above.&#160;&#160;The procurement by Seller of a
commitment for the issuance of the Title Policy without any exceptions to which
Buyer has objected or is deemed to have objected or with an endorsement thereto
insuring Buyer against any title exception which was disapproved pursuant to
this section (and so long as such endorsement is acceptable to Buyer in its sole
discretion) shall be deemed a cure by Seller of such disapproval.&#160;&#160;In
the event that Seller gives or is deemed to have given Buyer notice under
clause&#160;(b) above, Buyer shall have until the expiration of the Contingency
Period to notify Seller in writing that either (1)&#160;Buyer is willing to
purchase the Property subject to such disapproved exceptions, or (2)&#160;Buyer
elects to cancel this transaction.&#160;&#160;</font></div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 117pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>
        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
          <div id="FTR">
            <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">3</font></div>
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
            </div>
          </div>
          <div>
            <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
            </div>
          </div>
          <div>&#160;</div>
          <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Failure
of Buyer to take either one of the actions described in subsection&#160;(1) or
(2) above shall be deemed to be Buyer&#8217;s election to take the action described in
subsection&#160;(2) above.&#160;&#160;In the event this Agreement is canceled or
deemed canceled pursuant to this Section, except as otherwise provided herein,
the parties shall have no further obligations under this Agreement, and all
monies delivered to Escrow Holder (other than the First Deposit, which shall be
non-refundable), including any accrued interest thereon, by Buyer shall
immediately be returned to Buyer.&#160;&#160;Seller covenants after the
Contingency Period, that Seller will not cause title to the Real Property to
differ from the Approved Conditions of Title described in this
Section.&#160;&#160;Any liens, encumbrances, encroachments, easements,
restrictions, conditions, covenants, rights, rights-of-way or other matters
other than the Approved Conditions of Title which may appear of record or be
revealed after the Contingency Period that were not disclosed by the Title
Company or the Survey or otherwise actually known to Buyer prior to the
expiration of the Contingency Period or solely caused by Buyer, shall also be
subject to Buyer&#8217;s approval as a condition to the Close of Escrow for Buyer&#8217;s
benefit, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">provided that</font>
Buyer must notify Seller of such objection(s) to title within two&#160;(2)
business days of being made aware of the existence of such
exception.&#160;&#160;If Buyer gives such a notice to Seller, the provisions of
this Section&#160;6(a)(i)(a) above shall apply as if such notice was a Buyer&#8217;s
Title Notice, except that Buyer must respond within three&#160;(3) business days
to any response to such notice by Seller.&#160;&#160;The parties acknowledge
that Buyer&#8217;s Title Notice and Seller&#8217;s Title Notice have each been timely
delivered and Buyer has timely made the election referred to in subsection (1)
above with respect to Seller&#8217;s Title Notice.</font></div>
        </div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 9pt; TEXT-INDENT: 117pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(b)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Survey</font>.&#160;&#160;At
Buyer&#8217;s option and at its expense, during the Contingency Period Buyer may
obtain an update of the ALTA survey of the Property provided to Buyer by Seller
(&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Survey</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Buyer may
advise Seller in writing and in reasonable detail, not later than five&#160;(5)
business days prior to the close of the Contingency Period, what matters, if
any, shown on the Survey are not acceptable to Buyer (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Survey
Objections</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;Seller shall have three&#160;(3) business days
after receipt of Buyer&#8217;s Survey Objections to give Buyer notice that
(a)&#160;Seller will remove any Survey Objections (or afford the Title Company
necessary information or certifications to permit it to insure over such
matters) or (b)&#160;Seller elects not to cause such matters to be
removed.&#160;&#160;Seller&#8217;s failure to provide notice to Buyer within such
three&#160;(3) business day period as to any Survey Objection shall be deemed an
election by Seller not to remove the Survey Objection.&#160;&#160;If Seller so
notifies or is deemed to have notified Buyer that Seller shall not remove any or
all of the Survey Objections, Buyer&#8217;s delivery of the Approval Notice pursuant
to Section&#160;6(a)(ii) below shall indicate Buyer&#8217;s waiver of such objection
and its determination to proceed with the purchase and take the Property subject
to such matters.&#160;&#160;If obtained, Buyer shall promptly deliver a copy of
the Survey to Seller and the Title Company.&#160;&#160;It is acknowledged that
Buyer may not be entitled to obtain an ALTA title insurance policy with respect
to the Property if Buyer elects not to timely obtain a Survey on or before
five&#160;(5) days before the Close of Escrow with respect to the
Property.&#160;&#160;The parties acknowledge that Buyer has obtained an update
of the Survey and that Buyer has no Survey Objections in connection
therewith.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 72pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(ii)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Inspections and
Studies</font>.&#160;&#160;For a period commencing on the Effective Date and
expiring at 5:00&#160;p.m. P.T. on January&#160;31, 2008 (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Contingency Period</font>&#8221;), except
as otherwise extended pursuant to the provisions of this Section, Buyer shall
have the right to review and approve the (A)&#160;Documents and Materials (as
hereinafter defined), and (B)&#160;conduct any and all inspections,
investigations, tests and studies (including, without limitation, investigations
with regard to zoning, building codes and other governmental regulations,
architectural inspections, engineering tests, economic feasibility studies,
soils, seismic and geologic reports and environmental testing) with respect to
the Property as Buyer may elect to make or maintain.&#160;&#160;Any such entry
shall be upon reasonable notice to Seller and Seller shall be afforded the
opportunity to accompany Buyer during such visitations.&#160;&#160;Buyer shall
keep the Property free and clear of any mechanics&#8217; liens, materialmen&#8217;s liens or
claims arising out of any of Buyer&#8217;s activities or those of Buyer&#8217;s
representatives on or with respect to the Property.&#160;&#160;</font></div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 72pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>
        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
          <div id="FTR">
            <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
            </div>
          </div>
          <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">4</font></div>
            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
              <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
            </div>
          </div>
          <div>
            <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
            </div>
          </div>
          <div>&#160;</div>
          <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">All
entries onto the Property by Buyer and all inspections and examinations thereof
shall be at Buyer&#8217;s sole cost and expense, shall be done in a workmanlike manner
in accordance with all applicable codes, statutes, ordinances, rules,
regulations and laws.&#160;&#160;Buyer shall not perform any test or inspection
or carry out any activity at the Property which damages the Property in any way
or which is physically intrusive into the Improvements or soil of the Property
without the prior written consent of Seller, which Seller may withhold in its
reasonable discretion and shall be subject to such other reasonable conditions
as may be placed on such testing by Seller, including, without limitation, a
requirement that Buyer provide Seller split samples of any testing performed by
or on behalf of Buyer.&#160;&#160;After completion of any such inspection or
study on any portion of the Property, Buyer, at its sole cost and expense shall
repair (which shall include replacement where necessary) any damage to the
Property arising from such entry.&#160;&#160;In connection with any inspections
of the Property, Buyer and Buyer&#8217;s representatives will carry Commercial General
Liability insurance with a limit of Five Million Dollars ($5,000,000) per
occurrence and, upon the reasonable request of Seller, will provide Seller with
written evidence of same.&#160;&#160;Before performing any environmental
inspections or testing of the Property, Buyer shall obtain any required permits
and authorizations and shall pay all applicable fees required by any public body
or agency in connection therewith.&#160;&#160;Prior to the expiration of the
Contingency Period, Buyer shall deliver to Seller and Escrow Holder written
notice of its approval, which shall be made in Buyer&#8217;s sole and absolute
discretion, of the Property and the Documents and Materials (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Approval
Notice</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The failure of Buyer to deliver such notice prior to
the expiration of the Contingency Period shall be deemed to constitute Buyer&#8217;s
disapproval of such matters.&#160;&#160;The cost of any such inspections, tests
and/or studies shall be borne by Buyer.&#160;&#160;Between the Effective Date
and the Close of Escrow, Buyer, its agents, contractors and subcontractors shall
have the right to enter upon the Property at reasonable times to make any and
all inspections and tests as may be necessary or desirable in Buyer&#8217;s sole
judgment and discretion.&#160;&#160;Buyer shall indemnify, defend and hold
Seller harmless from any and all damage arising out of or in connection with
such entry upon the Property by Buyer, its agents, employees or contractors or
the performance by Buyer or Buyer&#8217;s representatives of any testing or
investigations of the Property (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Inspection Indemnity</font>&#8221;); <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">provided</font>, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">however</font>, that such Inspection
Indemnity shall not extend to any damages arising from or related to the
discovery of any pre-existing condition of the Property or to loss of value
resulting from such discovery thereof and/or further excepting the acts or
omissions of Seller or any of Seller&#8217;s agents, employees, contractors,
consultants, lessees, licensees or invitees.&#160;&#160;In the event Buyer
disapproves or is deemed to have disapproved the condition of the Property
and/or the Documents and Materials prior to the expiration of the Contingency
Period, except as otherwise provided herein, the parties shall have no further
obligations under this Agreement, the Second Deposit including any accrued
interest thereon, shall be immediately returned to Buyer, and Buyer shall return
to Seller any Documents and Materials provided to Buyer during the Contingency
Period.&#160;&#160;In the event that Buyer terminates this Agreement pursuant to
the provisions contained in this subsection&#160;(ii)(a), Buyer shall be
responsible for all escrow cancellation costs charged by Escrow
Holder.&#160;&#160;Buyer and its representatives shall hold in strictest
confidence all confidential data and information obtained with respect to Seller
or the Property and obtained in connection with the transaction contemplated by
this Agreement, whether obtained before or after the execution and delivery of
this Agreement, and shall not disclose the same to others; <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">provided</font>, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">however</font>, that it is
understood and agreed that the restrictions set forth herein shall not apply (a)
to disclosures which may otherwise be required by law, or (b) disclosures to
Buyer&#8217;s affiliates, and Buyer&#8217;s and such affiliates&#8217; respective directors,
officers, partners, members, managers, employees, legal counsel, accountants,
engineers, architects, financial advisors, brokers and similar professionals and
consultants (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Representatives</font>&#8221;) provided
that Buyer shall inform such persons to treat such data and information
confidentially.&#160;&#160;Buyer shall not be responsible for disclosures of
information which may otherwise become available to the public (other than from
disclosure by a Buyer or its Representatives).&#160;&#160;The indemnity
provisions of this Section&#160;6(a)(ii) shall survive the Close of Escrow and
delivery of the Deed and shall further survive any earlier termination of this
Agreement and the confidentiality provisions of this Section&#160;6(a)(ii) shall
survive the termination of this Agreement without a Close of Escrow for a period
of 36 months (and if the Close of Escrow occurs, Buyer&#8217;s obligation to keep
confidential information as set forth in this Section&#160;6(a)(ii) shall expire
as of the date of the Close of Escrow).&#160;&#160;</font></div>
          <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>
          <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">
            <div id="FTR">
              <div id="GLFTR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="left">
              </div>
            </div>
            <div id="PN" style="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: always">
              <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">5</font></div>
              <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center">
                <hr style="COLOR: black" noshade size="2">
              </div>
            </div>
            <div id="HDR">
              <div id="GLHDR" style="WIDTH: 100%" align="right">
              </div>
            </div>
          </div>
          <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>
          <div style="TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Buyer
acknowledges that it has completed the investigations set forth in this Section
6(a)(ii) and is satisfied with the results thereof, and execution of this
Agreement by Buyer shall be conclusively deemed to be timely delivery of Buyer&#8217;s
Approval Notice.</font></div>
        </div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 72pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 72pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(iii)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Title
Insurance</font>.&#160;&#160;As of the Close of Escrow, Title Company shall have
issued or shall have committed to issue the Title Policy (as hereinafter
defined) to Buyer.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 72pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(iv)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Seller&#8217;s
Obligations</font>.&#160;&#160;As of the Close of Escrow, Seller shall have
performed all of the obligations required to be performed by Seller under this
Agreement.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 72pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(v)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Seller&#8217;s
Representations</font>.&#160;&#160;As of the Close of Escrow, all
representations and warranties made by Seller to Buyer in this Agreement shall
be true and correct.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 72pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(vi)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">No Material
Change</font>.&#160;&#160;As of the Close of Escrow, there shall have been no
material change in the condition of the Property between the expiration of the
Contingency Period and the Close of Escrow; <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">provided</font>, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">however</font>, that the terms and
conditions of Section&#160;18(b) below shall apply as Buyer&#8217;s remedy with
respect to any such change in the condition of the Property due to fire or other
casualty.&#160;&#160;For purposes of this Section&#160;6(a)(vii), &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">material</font>&#8221; shall be deemed to
be any diminution in the value of the Property which exceeds two million and
0/100ths Dollars ($2,000,000.00).</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 72pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(vii)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Estoppel
Certificates</font>.&#160;&#160;As a condition precedent to Buyer&#8217;s obligation
to close hereunder, Buyer shall have received estoppel certificates dated no
more than thirty&#160;(30) days prior to the originally scheduled Close of
Escrow (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Estoppel
Certificates</font>&#8221;) from tenants, excluding Buyer or any affiliate of Buyer
which is also a tenant, that collectively occupy not less than seventy
percent&#160;(70%) of (i)&#160;the total rentable space actually leased as of
the Effective Date pursuant to valid and existing leases (excluding license
agreements and excluding the space leased by Buyer or any affiliate of Buyer),
less (ii)&#160;the total rentable space under lease by Buyer or any affiliate of
Buyer (the Estoppel Certificates to be delivered are collectively referred to as
the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Required Estoppel
Certificates</font>&#8221;); it being agreed that receipt of an Estoppel Certificate
from Buyer shall not be a condition precedent to Buyer&#8217;s obligation to
consummate the transaction contemplated by this Agreement.&#160;&#160;The
Estoppel Certificates delivered to the tenants for execution shall be in the
form of <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Exhibit&#160;K</font>
attached hereto (the &#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Form
Tenant Estoppel Certificate</font>&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The Estoppel Certificates
executed by tenants shall be in substantially the form of the Form Tenant
Estoppel Certificate; <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">provided</font>, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">however</font>, that an Estoppel
Certificate executed by a tenant shall not be deemed an unacceptable Estoppel
Certificate for purposes of this Section&#160;6(a)(vii) if it (a)&#160;contains
the qualification by the tenant of any statement as being to its knowledge or as
being subject to any similar qualification, or (b)&#160;does not contain any
more information than that which the tenant is required to give in any such
certificate pursuant to its lease.&#160;&#160;In the event that Seller does not
provide to Buyer the Required Estoppel Certificates on or prior to the third
business day prior to the Closing Date (subject to Seller&#8217;s right to extend the
Closing Date set forth in the last sentence of this subsection), Buyer may, by
written notice to Seller given on or prior to the Close of Escrow, either
(A)&#160;elect not to purchase the Property, in which event the Second Deposit
shall be returned to Buyer, at which time this Agreement shall terminate and
become null and void and neither party shall have any further rights or
obligations under this Agreement, except for those which expressly survive
termination of this Agreement, or (B)&#160;elect to purchase the Property
notwithstanding Seller&#8217;s inability to provide the Required Estoppel
Certificates, in which event Buyer shall be deemed to have waived the condition
contained in this Section&#160;6(a)(vii).&#160;&#160;If Buyer fails to deliver
such written notice as described above, Buyer shall be deemed to have elected
item&#160;(B) above.&#160;&#160;Information disclosed on any Estoppel
Certificate delivered to Buyer prior the Closing shall be deemed to have been
known by Buyer for purposes of the second sentence of Section
14(q).&#160;&#160;Seller shall have no liability in connection with Seller&#8217;s
representations or warranties set forth herein with respect to a particular
lease to the extent that such representations and warranties are confirmed by
the tenant under such lease in an Estoppel Certificate delivered with respect to
such lease.&#160; <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Seller
shall have the right to extend the Closing Date to any business day up to and
including March 3, 2008 if Seller determines such extension is necessary to
satisfy the condition set forth in this Section
6(a)(vii).</font>&#160;&#160;</font></div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 72pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>

        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 72pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(b)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Conditions to Seller&#8217;s
Obligations</font>.&#160;&#160;The Close of Escrow and Seller&#8217;s obligation to
consummate the transactions contemplated by this Agreement is subject to the
satisfaction of the following conditions (or Seller&#8217;s waiver thereof) which are
for Seller&#8217;s sole benefit, on or prior to the dates designated below for the
satisfaction of such conditions, or the Close of Escrow in absence of a
specified date:</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 72pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(i)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Buyer&#8217;s
Obligations</font>.&#160;&#160;As of the Close of Escrow, Buyer shall have
performed all of the obligations required to be performed by Buyer under this
Agreement.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 72pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(ii)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Buyer&#8217;s
Representations</font>.&#160;&#160;As of the Close of Escrow, all
representations and warranties made by Buyer to Seller in this Agreement shall
be true and correct.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 72pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(iii)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Buyer&#8217;s
Deliveries</font>.&#160;&#160;Delivery and execution by Buyer of all monies,
items and instruments required to be delivered by Buyer pursuant to this
Agreement;</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 72pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(iv)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Approval
Notice</font>.&#160;&#160;Buyer shall have timely waived the contingencies set
forth in Sections&#160;6(a)(i), (ii) and (vii).</font></div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(c)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Failure of Condition to
Close of Escrow</font>.&#160;&#160;In the event any of the conditions set forth
in Section&#160;6(a) or (b) are not timely satisfied or waived by Buyer or
Seller, as the case may be, for a reason other than the default of Buyer or
Seller, as the case may be, this Agreement shall terminate, and if applicable,
the Second Deposit (unless otherwise provided in this Agreement), and all
interest accrued thereon, and all other monies delivered to Escrow Holder by
Buyer shall be immediately be returned to Buyer, Buyer shall return to Seller
any Documents and Materials and, except as otherwise provided herein, the
parties shall have no further obligations hereunder.&#160;&#160;Buyer shall not
be required to deliver to Seller any reports or analyses (prepared by Buyer or
Buyer&#8217;s consultants or agents) concerning the Property, nor shall Buyer be
required to deliver to Seller any document which is privileged or is otherwise
legally protected from disclosure.&#160;&#160;The occurrence of the Close of
Escrow shall constitute satisfaction of conditions set forth in
Section&#160;6(a) and (b) not otherwise specifically satisfied or waived by
Buyer or Seller (except with respect to any intentional default or breach of
this Agreement by Seller, in which event (and notwithstanding anything to the
contrary contained herein), so long as Buyer has provided reasonable notice and
opportunity to cure to Seller (if reasonably practicable) with respect to such
intentional default or breach by Seller, Buyer may elect to close the subject
transaction but may make a claim for actual damage to the condition of the
Property incurred as a result of any such intentional default or breach of this
Agreement by Seller; <font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-STYLE: italic">provided
that</font> any such claim shall be limited by the restrictions on claims of
Buyer in connection with a breach of a Seller representation or warranty set
forth in Subsections&#160;14(q)(i) and (ii) of this Agreement.).</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">7.</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">DEPOSITS
BY SELLER</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">Unless
otherwise provided in this Section, prior to the Close of Escrow, Seller shall
deposit with Escrow Holder the following documents:</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(a)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Grant
Deed</font>.&#160;&#160;The Grant Deed, duly executed and acknowledged in
recordable form by Seller, conveying fee title to the Property to Buyer subject
only to the Approved Conditions of Title.</font></div>

        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(b)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">FIRPTA
Certificate</font>.&#160;&#160;A certification, acceptable to Escrow Holder and
duly executed by Seller under penalty of perjury setting forth Seller&#8217;s address
and federal tax identification number in accordance with and/or for the purpose
of the provisions of Sections&#160;7701 and 1445, as may be amended, of the
Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, and any regulations promulgated
thereunder.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(c)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">California Franchise Tax
Withholding</font>.&#160;&#160;Evidence satisfactory to Buyer and Escrow Holder
that Seller is exempt from the provisions of the withholding requirements of the
California Revenue and Taxation Code, as amended, and that neither Buyer nor
Escrow Holder is required to withhold any amounts from the Purchase Price
pursuant to such provisions.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(d)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Bill of
Sale</font>.&#160;&#160;A bill of sale (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">Bill of Sale</font>&#8221;), duly executed
by Seller in favor of Buyer, assigning and conveying to Buyer all of Seller&#8217;s
right, title and interest in and to the Personal Property.&#160;&#160;The Bill
of Sale shall be in the form of, and upon the terms contained in, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Exhibit&#160;C</font>
attached hereto.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(e)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Other
Documents</font>.&#160;&#160;Such other administrative documents as may be
reasonably necessary and appropriate to complete the Close of Escrow of the
transaction contemplated herein.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(f)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">General
Assignment</font>.&#160;&#160;An assignment (&#8220;<font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-WEIGHT: bold">General Assignment</font>&#8221;), duly
executed by Seller, assigning to Buyer all of Seller&#8217;s right, title and interest
in all Leases (as defined on <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Exhibit&#160;B</font>) and
Contracts (as defined on <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Exhibit&#160;B</font>) and
the Intangibles (as defined in the General Assignment).&#160;&#160;The General
Assignment shall be in the form of, and upon the terms contained in, <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Exhibit&#160;E</font>
attached hereto.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(g)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Tenant and Contract Notice
Letters</font>.&#160;&#160;one original notice letter to each tenant,
substantially in the form attached hereto as <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Exhibit&#160;L</font> (to be
delivered outside of escrow); and one original notice letter to each Contract
vendor, substantially in the form attached hereto as <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Exhibit&#160;M</font> (to be
delivered outside of escrow.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(h)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Contracts and
Leases</font>.&#160;&#160;The original (or copies if Seller is not in possession
of the originals) of the Contracts approved by Buyer in accordance with this
Agreement if required, together with any warranties related to such Contracts
including, without limitation any operating manuals for Building systems and
components.&#160;&#160;The original (or copies if Seller is not in possession of
the originals) of the Leases.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(i)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Keys</font>.&#160;&#160;Keys
to all entrance doors to the Improvements and keys to all Personal Property
located on the Property, which keys shall be properly tagged for
identification.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(j)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Seller&#8217;s
Certificate</font>.&#160;&#160;A certificate in the form of <font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Exhibit&#160;H</font>
attached hereto, confirming that the representations and warranties made by
Seller in this Agreement are true, correct and complete in all material respects
as of the Close of Escrow.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(k)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">Permits, Entitlements,
etc</font>.&#160;&#160;Any original building and development permits,
certificates of occupancy, utility will-serve letters, use permits and other
government approvals and/or entitlements with respect to the
Property.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 36pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">(l)</font><font id="TAB2" style="COLOR: black; LETTER-SPACING: 9pt">&#160;</font><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; TEXT-DECORATION: underline">January 31, 2008
Letter</font>.&#160;&#160;Concurrently with the execution of this Agreement,
that certain January 31, 2008 letter from Harvest Properties, Inc. to BlackRock
Realty Advisors, Inc. in the form attached as Exhibit &#8220;N&#8221;.</font></div>
        <div style="DISPLAY: block; MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt; TEXT-ALIGN: justify" align="justify">&#160;</div>
        <div id="PGBRK" style="MARGIN-LEFT: 0pt; TEXT-INDENT: 0pt; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0pt">

            <div style="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: center"><font style="DISPLAY: inline; FONT-SIZE: 10pt; FONT-FAMILY: Times New Roman">8</font></div>
